verses.verse: How beautiful <WH3302> <WH8804> are thy feet <WH6471> with shoes <WH5275>, O prince's <WH5081> daughter <WH1323> ! the joints <WH2542> of thy thighs <WH3409> are like jewels <WH2481>, the work <WH4639> of the hands <WH3027> of a cunning workman <WH542>.

Thy navel <WH8326> is like a round <WH5469> goblet <WH101>, which wanteth <WH2637> <WH8799> not liquor <WH4197>: thy belly <WH990> is like an heap <WH6194> of wheat <WH2406> set about <WH5473> <WH8803> with lilies <WH7799>.
Thy two <WH8147> breasts <WH7699> are like two <WH8147> young <WH6082> roes <WH6646> that are twins <WH8380>.

Thy neck <WH6677> is as a tower <WH4026> of ivory <WH8127>; thine eyes <WH5869> like the fishpools <WH1295> in Heshbon <WH2809>, by the gate <WH8179> of Bathrabbim <WH1337>: thy nose <WH639> is as the tower <WH4026> of Lebanon <WH3844> which looketh <WH6822> <WH8802> toward <WH6440> Damascus <WH1834>.
Thine head <WH7218> upon thee is like Karmel <WH3760>, and the hair <WH1803> of thine head <WH7218> like purple <WH713>; the king <WH4428> is held <WH631> <WH8803> in the galleries <WH7298>.
How fair <WH3302> <WH8804> and how pleasant <WH5276> <WH8804> art thou, O love <WH160>, for delights <WH8588> !
This thy stature <WH6967> is like <WH1819> <WH8804> to a palm tree <WH8558>, and thy breasts <WH7699> to clusters <WH811> of grapes.

I said <WH559> <WH8804>, I will go up <WH5927> <WH8799> to the palm tree <WH8558>, I will take hold <WH270> <WH8799> of the boughs <WH5577> thereof: now also thy breasts <WH7699> shall be as clusters <WH811> of the vine <WH1612>, and the smell <WH7381> of thy nose <WH639> like apples <WH8598>;

And the roof of thy mouth <WH2441> like the best <WH2896> wine <WH3196> for my beloved <WH1730>, that goeth <WH1980> <WH8802> down sweetly <WH4339>, causing the lips <WH8193> of those that are asleep <WH3463> to speak <WH1680> <WH8802>.
I am my beloved's <WH1730>, and his desire <WH8669> is toward me.
Come <WH3212> <WH8798>, my beloved <WH1730>, let us go forth <WH3318> <WH8799> into the field <WH7704>; let us lodge <WH3885> <WH8799> in the villages <WH3723>.

Let us get up early <WH7925> <WH8686> to the vineyards <WH3754>; let us see <WH7200> <WH8799> if the vine <WH1612> flourish <WH6524> <WH8804>, whether the tender grape <WH5563> appear <WH6605> <WH8765>, and the pomegranates <WH7416> bud forth <WH5132> <WH8689>: there will I give <WH5414> <WH8799> thee my loves <WH1730>.

The mandrakes <WH1736> give <WH5414> <WH8804> a smell <WH7381>, and at our gates <WH6607> are all manner of pleasant <WH4022> fruits, new <WH2319> and old <WH3465>, which I have laid up <WH6845> <WH8804> for thee, O my beloved <WH1730>.
